result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall James Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact [Modifiers: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).
  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact [Modifiers: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 2 and consecutive to any other sentence

records.addlTxt:
3:29 PM Defendant Randall James Davis in court, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch in court for Randall James Davis.  Attorney Emily Eklund in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Dolch states joint recommendation.  State agrees.  No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Counts 3 & 4: Dismissed but read in 

Counts 1 & 2:

WI State Prison for 20 years on each count (12 years Initial Confinement/8 years Extended Supervision), concurrent to each other and consecutive to any other sentence
62 days jail credit

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
  
Submit to DNA Sample
Lifetime supervision after discharge from extended supervision
Lifetime sex offender registry
Sex offender treatment & rules
No contact with C.J.B., Z.G.N., D.T.W. or S.K.W.
$518.00 Costs & Supervision Fees x 2 to be paid during extended supervision
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Not Eligible for Substance Abuse Program

Paperwork handed in court.
Atty Dolch received and waives reading of the Information.  DE advised of charges and penalties.

3:33 PM 3:29 PM Defendant Randall James Davis in court, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch in court for Randall James Davis.  Attorney Emily Eklund in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.
Waiver of Prelim on August 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:12 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randall James Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes appeared by video for Randall James Davis.  Court states case and appearances.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  State makes bail argument - requests $50,000 cash bond w/conditions noting the DE's prior convictions.  Atty Hayes responds - requests DE's address be changed to the Sauk Co Jail.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $2,500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/anyone under the age of 18 and absolute sobriety.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Return date scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on August 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 29, 2022 at 11:15 am.
